quest.name: Look to the Stars
journal: Almet stands ready to guide you through the ruins.
objectives: Use the clay tablets on the inscriptions.
Deliver the clay tablets to Y'shtola.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We must make haste and see this done. The Qitana Ravel and the Lightwarden await.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: What you seek lies in the heart of the K'mul Astropolis.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, it too was sealed shut by order of His Eminence.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: If we are to open it, we must first look to the Morning Stars. Come, I will show you the way.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Looking upon these structures, I cannot help but be reminded of ruins in Gyr Abania. Yet the manner in which they appear to be suppressing the natural flow of aether is more akin to the Allagan pillars in the House of the Crooked Coin...

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: You were able to keep up, I see. Well done.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Ahead lie the Morning Stars, four monuments built in tribute to the guardians of Rak'tika.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Beyond them is the Great Pyramid of Ux'ner, where the flow of magic must be restored.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: It is said that the monuments are themselves the keys to opening the pyramid.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Though I know not how. That is for you to discover.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...Another puzzle. Wonderful.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I would have a closer look.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: I must confess, there are times when I too wonder what lies within these ruins. But I would never defy the will of the emperor.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It is indeed another puzzle, but for a blessing, it appears to be similar to the one we encountered at the lake.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: These statues are all depictions of the divine beasts mentioned on the tablet.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: No doubt they will open the way into the pyramid in like manner.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We have but to discern the correct order. Let's split up and search the area for clues.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: These ruins are covered in ancient inscriptions. The answer may well be hiding among them.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Indeed. It may be best to transcribe them if they are as numerous as you say. Better that than risk overlooking something.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Though transcription would prove impractical for you, not being versed in Ronkan script... No matter. You will employ a different approach: impressions.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Here. I had thought to use these clay tablets to record any significant imagery we discovered, but they will serve you just as well. Take impressions of any inscriptions you find.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We will start at the base of the pyramids. You begin at the top.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: When you have finished, return here and I will translate your findings.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Did you find anything?

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: There are so many inscriptions... I scarcely know where to start.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You take an impression of the writing inscribed on the monument.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Finished? Take what you have to Y'shtola. I will join you anon.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I trust you've made good use of those clay tablets?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Well done. A moment while I decipher what you've found.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Apologies for the delay.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Nothing we saw at the base of the pyramids gave any hint as to the solution of the puzzle, focusing instead on how to proceed having solved it. Your findings, on the other hand, appear to form a riddle. Once assembled, it reads as follows...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: “Come together, share despair.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: “Go thy ways, dread burdens bear.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: “Mark the crown, heed its call.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: “Avert thy gaze, forever fall.”

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I had assumed that the puzzle would involve a sequence, but from what Almet and I were able to gather, it is but a matter of suffusing one of the statues with aether.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The question being: which one?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Have you any thoughts?

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text:
“Come together, share despair,
Go thy ways, dread burdens bear...

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text:
“Mark the crown, heed its call,
Avert thy gaze, forever fall.”
Such cryptic writings. How are they related to the divine beasts?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Examining the serpent statue, you notice it is facing away from the coeurl statue.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Examining the coeurl statue, you notice it is facing away from the serpent statue.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Examining the colibri statue, you notice it is facing south toward the woods.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Examining the owl statue, you notice it is facing north toward the Great Pyramid.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Examining the wolf statue, you notice it is facing towards the opo-opo statue.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Examining the opo-opo statue, you notice it is facing towards the wolf statue.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Given your talent for finding solutions to vexatious problems, I think it best that you choose the statue. What say you, Forename?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Offer Y'shtola your thoughts?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If you need more time to consider, take it─but do make haste. I would suggest seeking Almet's counsel, but she seems rather preoccupied with reciting the riddle.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: At the very least, you should consider having a second look at the statues themselves. Perhaps they offer some clue as to which is the correct choice.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Right, then. After you have selected a statue, I will imbue it with the required aether.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Should it prove to be a trap, I am more than capable of warding off any malign magicks it may contain.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Now, which statue will it be?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: The serpent statue.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: The coeurl statue.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: The colibri statue.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: The owl statue.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: The wolf statue.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: The opo-opo statue.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Might I hear the riddle one more time?

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Yes, of course. I have it written here.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text:
“Come together, share despair,
Go thy ways, dread burdens bear...

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text:
“Mark the crown, heed its call,
Avert thy gaze, forever fall.”

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Did that serve to inspire you?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: All right. I pray this works.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Gah! ...It seems you were mistaken.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I am fine. Though I would rather not go through that again.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Next time, choose more carefully.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: All right. I pray this works.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The aether has been absorbed...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: You really do have a talent for these things.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: A moment. Maintaining my wards has proven more taxing than anticipated.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: The way should be clear now. Come, let us─

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Someone approaches!

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: Sister! <pant> <pant> Sister!

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Cymet?

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: What are you doing here? What has happened?

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: Eulmoran soldiers. They have entered Yx'Maja!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Eulmoran soldiers!? And what of the Blessed?

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: Nothing specific, but it seems the Eulmorans had little interest in Slitherbough or its people.

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: According to our scouts, their general and his men made all haste for the gate to Yx'Maja upon finding it.

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: Together with Thancred, Uimet and some few others have engaged them at the border.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: You are to return and assist Uimet at once.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: They are not to set foot near the ruins or Fanow.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: We will see to matters here and return as quickly as we can. Understood?

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: Yes, Sister. Be careful.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Though I knew time was short, I did not expect the Eulmorans to move so swiftly...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: But we have come too far to turn back now.
